| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Transforms you into a swirling mass of dark shadows. While in this form, you are permanently invisible and are immune to poison, draining, torment, and hostile enchantments. All incoming damage will be halved, and you will bleed smoke on any incoming attack. However, your ability to deal damage in melee and with ranged attacks will be halved, your spellcasting power will be greatly hampered, and your skills will be further drained when taking damage.Invocations skill increases the duration of the transformation. |

**Shadow Form** is a transformation which turns you into an immaterial shadow being. This is an entirely defensive form, greatly increasing your ability to survive dangerous situations, though at significant cost to your offensive capabilities.

Shadow Form is only available through worshiping [Dithmenos](/Dithmenos "Dithmenos"), costs 9 [MP](/MP "MP"), 10-15 [piety](/Piety "Piety"), and lightly [drains](/Draining "Draining") you when activated.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Shadow Form does the following:

**Combat**

- [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility")
- ×50% damage to [weapons](/Weapon "Weapon") (including [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat"))
- Two negative [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power") enhancements
- 50% reduction to all damage taken

**Resistances**

- [Poison immunity](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- Immunity to external sources of [draining](/Draining "Draining")
- [Torment](/Torment "Torment") immunity
- Will∞ (immune to hostile enchantments)
- Immunity to [petrification](/Petrification "Petrification")
- Immunity to [backlighting](/Corona "Corona") (e.g. [Corona](/Corona "Corona") or glow from high [magic contamination](/Magic_contamination "Magic contamination"))

**Other**

- You [bleed smoke](/Scroll_of_fog "Scroll of fog") when taking damage
- Taking damage inflicts further, unavoidable [drain](/Drain "Drain")
- [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") score multiplied by 2

Shadow Form does not [meld](/Meld "Meld") any equipment and does not [fly](/Fly "Fly"). Despite its similarity to the [undead](/Undead "Undead"), Shadow Form is not vulnerable to [holy](/Holy "Holy") or [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath"). It uses the same size and movement speed as your base species.

Even the [undead](/Undead "Undead") can use Shadow Form.

## Strategy

Shadow Form is clearly meant as an escape tool. The combination of [invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility") and bleeding [smoke clouds](/Scroll_of_fog "Scroll of fog") allows you to shake off ranged attackers and unintelligent melee enemies. Should you be chased by something that can [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible") and keep up with you, increasing your speed with [Swiftness](/Swiftness "Swiftness") or a [potion of haste](/Potion_of_haste "Potion of haste"), or simply [teleporting](/Teleport "Teleport") away, is recommended.

It's also perfect for ninja'ing runes. You can break into a rune vault, grab the rune via [Apportation](/Apportation "Apportation"), and teleport or [translocate](/Translocations "Translocations") away. The 50% damage reduction is very significant, even before considering the resistances. However, you'll almost certainly wind up with heavy draining once you're in the clear. And, if you haven't cleared the rest of the floor, your getaway might not be as safe as you'd hoped.

As a general combat buff, Shadow Form is very costly, and usually counter productive. It inflicts heavy [drain](/Drain "Drain"), costs a lot of piety, and reduces your offensive capabilities. But it *does* have a niche. Dedicated [stabbers](/Stab "Stab") can take advantage of the invis-stabs. The infinite [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") can be used to block hex effects, whether from [uniques](/Unique "Unique") or standard monsters. Could also be used for poison resistance in a pinch, though there are usually better sources.

### Tips & Tricks

- If you aren't flying, watch out for [water](/Water "Water"), which will reveal your position to monsters.

## History

- In [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), Shadow Form will be removed from the game.
- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Shadow Form was not immune to [backlighting](/Corona "Corona").

Shadow Form

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Transforms you into a swirling mass of dark shadows. While in this form, you are permanently invisible and are immune to poison, draining, torment, and hostile enchantments. All incoming damage will be halved, and you will bleed smoke on any incoming attack. However, your ability to deal damage in melee and with ranged attacks will be halved, your spellcasting power will be greatly hampered, and your skills will be further drained when taking damage.

Invocations skill increases the duration of the transformation.

Shadow Form is a transformation which turns you into an immaterial shadow being. This is an entirely defensive form, greatly increasing your ability to survive dangerous situations, though at significant cost to your offensive capabilities.

Shadow Form is only available through worshiping Dithmenos, costs 9 MP, 10-15 piety, and lightly drains you when activated.

Contents

  • 2 Strategy

  • 3 History

Combat

  • Two negative spell power enhancements
  • 50% reduction to all damage taken

  • Torment immunity
  • Will∞ (immune to hostile enchantments)
  • Immunity to petrification

Even the undead can use Shadow Form.

As a general combat buff, Shadow Form is very costly, and usually counter productive. It inflicts heavy drain, costs a lot of piety, and reduces your offensive capabilities. But it does have a niche. Dedicated stabbers can take advantage of the invis-stabs. The infinite willpower can be used to block hex effects, whether from uniques or standard monsters.   • If you aren't flying, watch out for water, which will reveal your position to monsters.
